content:
Yes, there have been some notable changes in the types of podcasts that have gained popularity during the pandemic. Some of the changes include:

1. Health and wellness: With the pandemic causing a lot of stress and anxiety, people have turned to podcasts that offer advice and tips on how to stay healthy and cope with the pandemic.

2. True crime: True crime podcasts have always been popular, but during the pandemic, many people found solace in these podcasts as they could escape from the reality of the pandemic and indulge in their favorite genre.

3. News and politics: With the pandemic causing so much uncertainty, people have turned to podcasts that offer a deeper understanding of the news and politics of the moment.

4. Mental health: Mental health podcasts have seen a surge in popularity as people cope with the stress and anxiety caused by the pandemic.

5. Remote working: As more and more people work from home, podcasts that offer tips and advice on remote working have become more popular.
